%text Expressing one polynomial as the \underline\text{product} of two or more other polynomials is called factorization.
For example, % \begin{align} x^2 - 3x + 2 &= (x-1)\cdot (x-2) \\ x^3-1 &= (x-1)\cdot (x^2 + x + 1) \\ x^4 - 1 &= (x-1)\cdot (x+1)\cdot (x^2 + 1) \end{align} %text
Factorizing is something you will do often in the course of your studies.
So, it is best if you get comfortable with it. %
